document_data.name: Wakadoshiyori
document_data.mainbody: The '''wakadoshiyori''' were an office of the shogunate of [[Wa]]. They were the fourth most important office in the hierarchy of the shogunate.
document_data.Organization:
The wakadoshiyori were considered subordinates of the Council of Elders, called the [[roju]]. Between two and four officials served in this role.

Like all other positions in the shogunate, to be a junior elder was a coveted role, and only the shogun could approve such an appointment.
document_data.Activities: These junior elders had similar duties to members of the roju but particularly oversaw the [[daimyo]]'s [[hatamono]], or "bannermen". They also performed a miscellany of other activities, such as inspecting public buildings or supervising the appointment of staff and counselors to the daimyo.
